newsitem.title: POLAND: BOXING-POLISH COURT CUTS GOLOTA'S SUSPENDED SENTENCE.
newsitem.headline: BOXING-POLISH COURT CUTS GOLOTA'S SUSPENDED SENTENCE.

text.p: A Polish appeal court on Thursday cut the suspended jail term given to U.S.-based heavyweight boxer Andrew Golota in January when he came home to Poland to face the music over a 1990 restaurant brawl.
The court cut his sentence from two years to one, suspended for three years, and ruled he would not have to pay a 20,000 zloty ($7,000) fine.
Last year Golota, 29, squandered two almost certain victories against American ex-world champion Riddick Bowe by landing low blows.
